alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 3:03AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CHST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...All areas of Guam. * WHEN...Until 500 AM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 303 AM ChST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.6 and 1.8 inches of rain have fallen. Doppler radar indicates moderate to heavy rainfall will persist another 1 to 2 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.8 to 2.2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dededo, Tamuning, Yigo, Mangilao, Chalan Pago-Ordot, Barrigada, Yona, Hagatna Heights, Andersen AFB, Talofofo, Mongmong-Toto-Maite, Sinajana, Inarajan, Asan, Merizo, Piti, Santa Rita and Umatac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
